tuv.seg: Taxation of social welfare payments
Gearradh cánach ar íocaíochtaí leasa shóisialaigh
All income in Ireland is generally subject to taxation
Go hiondúil, gearrtar cáin ar gach ioncam in Éirinn
Your social welfare payment may or may not be deemed taxable but even if your social welfare payment is taxable, you may not actually have to pay tax on it
D'fhéadfadh d'íocaíocht leasa shóisialaigh a bheith inchánaithe nó saor ó cháin
If you are getting a social welfare payment you get a PAYE tax credit in addition to your normal tax credits
Fiú má tá d'íocaíocht leasa shóisialaigh inchánaithe, tá seans fós ann nach n-íocfaidh tú cáin uirthi
This means, if a social welfare payment is your only source of income you may not pay tax because your tax liability does not exceed your tax credits
Má tá tú ag fáil íocaíocht leasa shóisialaigh, gheobhaidh tú creidmheas cánach ÍMAT chomh maith leis na gnáth-chreidmheasanna cánach
The PAYE tax credit is given to the person claiming the social welfare payment and not to the adult dependant even if the Increase for a Qualified Adult is paid directly to the dependant
Dá thoradh, más íocaíocht leasa shóisialaigh an t-aon foinse ioncaim atá agat, ní bheidh cáin le híoc agat toisc nach sáraíonn do dhliteanas cánach do chreidmheasanna cánach
Universal Social Charge and social insurance (PRSI) is not payable on social welfare payments
Ní bhaineann an Muirear Sóisialta Uilíoch (MSU) le híocaíochtaí leasa shóisialaigh
Social welfare payment and another income
Íocaíocht leasa shóisialaigh agus ioncam eile
If you have a social welfare payment and another source of income, you may have to pay tax
Má tá íocaíocht leasa shóisialaigh chomh maith le foinse eile ioncaim agat, d'fhéadfadh sé go mbeadh cáin le n-íoc aige/aici
In this case, your taxable social welfare payment and your other income are added together
Sa chás seo, beidh d’íocaíocht inchánaithe agus d’fhoinse eile ioncaim suimithe
You are taxed on the total amount
Gearrtar cáin ar an méid iomlán
There is no mechanism for taxing social welfare payments at source (before it is paid to you)
Níl aon bhealach i bhfeidhm le cáin a ghearradh ar phinsin leasa shóisalaigh ag an bhfoinse, i bhfocail eile, sula n-íoctar an pinsean leat
Your non-social welfare income determines how tax due is paid
Braitheann an córas cánach ar an bhfoinse eile ioncaim atá agat
For example, you are getting a social welfare pension and an occupational pension
Mar shampla, má tá íocaíocht leasa shóisialaigh agus pinsean gairme agat, gearrtar cáin air tríd an gcóras ÍMAT air, díreach mar an gcéanna leis an gcóras nuair a ghearrtar cáin ar phá nó tuarastal
Your occupational pension is taxed through the Pay-As-You-Earn (PAYE) system in the same way as a wage or salary
Is ionann é seo agus a rá go bhfaigheann tú chreidmheasanna cánach sa ghnáthbhealach
This means that you get your tax credits in the normal way. In order to tax your social welfare pension, your annual tax credits are reduced by the tax liability on your social welfare pension

Chun cáin a ghearradh ar an bpinsean leasa shóisialaigh, déantar scoithphointe an ráta chaighdeánaigh a laghdú faoi mhéid an phinsin leasa shóisialaigh agus déantar na creidmheasanna cánach a laghdú faoin dliteanas cánach ar an bpinsean leasa shóisialaigh
You then effectively pay tax on both the pensions, but it is collected from the occupational pension
Mar sin, is amhlaidh go n-íoctar cáin ar an dá phinsean ach íoctar í tríd an bpinsean ceirde
The technical term for this is coding in of credits
Tugtar "códú" creidmheasanna ar an nós seo
The same arrangement applies if you have income from a job and a social welfare payment
Cuirtear an nós imeachta céanna i bhfeidhm má tá ioncam agat ó phost agus má tá pinsean leasa shóisialaigh aige/aici
If your social welfare payment was not coded in, you would have to pay tax as a self-employed person and in a lump sum by 31 October each year
Muna mbeadh do phinsean leasa shóisialaigh curtha san áireamh sa bhealach seo, bheadh cáin le n-íoc air ina cnapshuim go bliantúil mar dhuine féinfhostaithe faoin 31 mí Dheireadh Fómhair

If your other source of income is not taxed through the PAYE system, for example, if you are self-employed, have an occupational pension from abroad or have investment income, then you are classed as a self-employed person and your tax is payable annually by 31 October each year

Mura n-íocann tú cáin ar an bhfoinse ioncaim eile atá agat tríd an gcóras ÍMAT, cuir i gcás go bhfuil pinsean gairme ó thír thar lear nó ioncam infheistíochta agat, cuirtear tú san aicme féinfhostaithe agus ní mór an cháin a íoc ina cnapshuim go bliantúil roimh 31 Deireadh Fómhair
Social security pensions from abroad
Pinsin leasa shóisialaigh nó pinsin slándála sóisialaí ó thír eile
If you have a social security pension from abroad, it is also generally taxable in Ireland
Má tá pinsean slándála sóisialaí ó thír eile agat, is iondúil go bhfuil sé inchánaithe in Éirinn
The tax is payable annually unless you have a source of income that is subject to PAYE
Ní mór an cháin a íoc go bliantúil mura bhfuil foinse ioncaim eile agat a thiteann faoin gcóras ÍMAT
Certain foreign pensions that would be exempt from tax if you were resident in the country paying the pension, are however also exempt from tax in Ireland
Tá pinsin eachtrannacha áirithe a bheadh saor ó cháin dá mbeadh faighteoir an phinsin ina chónaí sa tír as atá an pinsean ag teacht agus mar sin tá siad saor ó cháin in Éirinn chomh maith
Universal Social Charge and PRSI are not payable
Íocaíochtaí leasa shóisialaigh Éireannacha
The Department of Social Protection (DSP) will pay Maternity Benefit without any deduction of tax
Bíonn Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist inchánaithe go ginearálta, ach bíonn an chéad €13 gach seachtain saor ó cháin
However the DSP will notify Revenue of the amount of Maternity Benefit to be taken into account for income tax purposes
Níl Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist atá iníochta le hoibreoirí gearrthréimhseacha inchánaithe
If you are self-employed and pay your tax through the self-assessment system you should include details of any Maternity Benefit received in your annual tax return

Níl Méaduithe i leith Leanaí Cáilithe atá iníochta le Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist, Sochar Breoiteachta agus an Scéim Díobhálacha Ceirde (Sochar Díobhála, Pinsean Míchumais agus Forlíonadh Easláinte) inchánaithe

If you pay tax through the PAYE system Revenue will, where possible, automatically reduce your annual tax credits and rate bands to account for the tax payable on your Maternity Benefit (see 'Further information' below for examples)
Seachas na cásanna thuas, má tá d’íocaíocht leasa shóisialaigh inchánaithe, beidh aon mhéadú ar d’íocaíocht le haghaidh do chleithiúnaí aosaigh inchánaithe chomh maith
You can also read our case study
Níl Sochar Linbh inchánaithe

If you were getting Maternity Benefit up to and including 30 June 2013 you may be entitled to a tax and PRSI refund if your Maternity Benefit is paid to your employer and your employer continues to pay your normal weekly wage
Íocaíochtaí caomhnóra, arb íocaíochtaí iad a rinneadh ar mhaithe le dílleachta, inchánaithe

If this is the case, when your Maternity Benefit has finished, you can write to the Maternity Benefit Section or contact the Maternity Benefit Section online to request an MB21 Statement, which you should then forward to your tax office to get a tax refund

Meastar gur réadmhaoin thairbhiúil an linbh íocaíocht chaomhnóra agus tá sé inmheasúnaithe, ar an ábhar sin, i leith a n-ioncaim (más ann dó), seachas i leith ioncam an duine a fhaigheann an íocaíocht chaomhnóra
They do this by including the taxable amount of Illness or Injury Benefit with the employee’s earnings
│An Díbhinn Teaghlaigh um Fhilleadh ar │Saor ó cháin │ │Obair │ │
Jobseeker’s Benefit and One-Parent Family Payment
│Liúntas Cuardaitheora Poist │Saor ó cháin │
One-Parent Family Payment is taxed in the same way
│Socrú idirthréimhseach Liúntas │Saor ó cháin │
No PRSI or USC is payable
│Cuardaitheora Poist │ │
Jobseeker's Benefit payable to short-time workers is not taxable
│Liúntas Réamhscoir │Saor ó cháin │
Guardian's payments, which are payments made for the benefit of an orphan, are taxable
│Cúnamh Feirme │Saor ó cháin │
Payments that are not taxed

Family Income Supplement Not taxed
│Liúntas Cúramóra │Inchánaithe │
Fuel Allowance Not taxed
│Liúntas Leasa Forlíontach │Saor ó cháin │
Household Benefits Scheme Not taxed
│Pinsean Stáit (Neamhranníocach) │Inchánaithe │
Jobseeker's Allowance Not taxed
│Pinsean na nDall │Inchánaithe │
Jobseeker's Transitional payment Not taxed
│Liúntas Míchumais │Saor ó cháin │
Pre-Retirement Allowance Not taxed
│Liúntas Banchéile Thréigthe │Inchánaithe │
Supplementary Welfare Allowance Not taxed
│Íocaíocht Teaghlaigh Aontuismitheora │Inchánaithe │
Deserted Wife’s Allowance Taxable
│Sochar Atharthachta │Inchánaithe │
Disablement Pension Taxable (except for child increases)
│Sochar Breoiteachta │Inchánaithe (ach amháin │
Guardian's Payment (Contributory) Taxable (on child's income)
│ │méadaithe cleithiúnaí linbh) │
Guardian's Payment (Non-Contributory) Taxable (on child's income)
│Sochar Máithreachais │Inchánaithe (ón 1 Iúil 2013) │
Health and Safety Benefit Taxable (since 1 July 2013)
│Sochar Uchtála │Inchánaithe (ón 1 Iúil 2013) │
Maternity Benefit Taxable (since 1 July 2013)
│Sochar Sláinte agus Sábháilteachta │Inchánaithe (ón 1 Iúil 2013) │
One-Parent Family Payment Taxable
│Pinsean Míchumais │Inchánaithe │
Partial Capacity Benefit Taxable
│Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist │Inchánaithe (ach amháin │
State Pension (Contributory) Taxable
│Liúntas Fiontraíochta Gearrthréimhseach │Inchánaithe │
State Pension (Non-Contributory) Taxable
│hoibrithe gearr-ama) │ │
Widow’s, Widower’s or Surviving Civil Partner's (Contributory) Pension Taxable
│Pinsean Baintrí, Baintrí Fir nó Páirtnéara │Inchánaithe │
Widow’s, Widower’s or Surviving Civil Partner's (Non-Contributory) Pension Taxable Other schemes
│Shibhialta Mharthanaigh (Ranníocach) │ │
The Vocational Training Opportunities Scheme (VTOS) is not taxable
│Íocaíocht Chaomhnóra (Ranníocach) │Inchánaithe (ar ioncam linbh) │
The Water Conservation Grant (paid annually to households registered with Irish Water) is exempt from income tax
│Sochar Banchéile Thréigthe │Inchánaithe │
Payments made under the Community Employment scheme, Rural Social Scheme (RSS), Tús, Gateway and the Community Services Programme are taxable
If the underlying payment is not taxable, JobBridge payments are not taxable
│Sochar Cumais Pháirtigh │Inchánaithe │
You may get an increase in your social welfare payment, if you are living alone
│Pinsean Stáit (Ranníocach │Inchánaithe │
If your social welfare payment is taxable, then the Living Alone Increase is taxable
│Pinsean Stáit (Ranníocach) │Inchánaithe │
If your social welfare payment is not taxable, then your Living Alone Increase is not taxable
│Liúntas Freastail Leanúnach ( Iníoctha le │Inchánaithe │
No tax is deducted at source by the Department of Social Protection
│Sochar Gortaithe │Inchánaithe │
All enquiries about your tax liability should be addressed to your local tax office
│Pinsean Sochair Báis │Inchánaithe │
If you pay tax through the PAYE system you will probably fall into one of the following 3 categories:
Níl an Liúntas um Fhilleadh ar Obair; an Liúntas Fiontraíochta um Fhilleadh ar Obair agus an Liúntas um Fhilleadh ar Oideachas inchánaithe
Revenue will reduce your tax credits and rate band to account for the tax payable on your Maternity Benefit and in this way collect the tax due
Níl íocaíochtaí a dhéanann an CGO faoin Scéim Deiseanna Oiliúna Ghairmoideachais (SDOG) inchánaithe
Revenue will then send a revised tax credit certificate to your employer
Níl an Deontas Caomhnaithe Uisce inchánaithe
2. You are paid your full or partial salary by your employer and your Maternity Benefit is paid directly to you
Tá íocaíochtaí faoin Scéim Shóisialta Tuaithe (RSS), TÚS agus faoin gClár Seirbhísí Pobail inchánaithe

Revenue will reduce your tax credits and rate band to account for the tax payable on your Maternity Benefit and your employer should only deduct tax, USC and PRSI only on the amount of salary actually paid by them

Tá íocaíochtaí a dhéantar faoi JobBridge, an Scéim Náisiúnta Intéirneachta, inchánach má tá an íocaíocht bhunúsach leasa shóisialaigh inchánach. Mura bhfuil an íocaíocht bhunúsach inchánach, nach bhfuil íocaíochtaí JobBridge inchánach
3. You do not get any salary while on maternity leave and your Maternity Benefit is paid directly to you
Má tá tú i do chónaí i d'aonar, d'fhéadfá méadú ar d'íocaíocht leasa shóisialaigh a fháil
Revenue will reduce your tax credits and rate band to account for the tax payable on your Maternity Benefit
Má tá d'íocaíocht leasa shóisialaigh inchánaithe, tá anMéadú do Mhaireachtáil Aonair inchánaithe
If your only income is Maternity Benefit you will probably pay very little or no tax (since your total tax credits will probably exceed your total tax liability)
Mura mbíonn d'íocaíocht leasa shóisialaigh inchánaithe, níl do Mhéadú do Mhaireachtáil Aonair inchánaithe
Alternatively, when you go back to work after maternity leave, any refund of tax which may be due can be calculated
De ghnáth, níl an Liúntas Cúram Baile agus an Liúntas Breosla inchánaithe
